item.title: Docs: Vagrant
item.description:
Vagrant provides easy to configure, reproducible, and portable work environments. Automagically. To achieve this, Vagrant stands on the shoulders of giants. Machines are provisioned on top of VirtualBox, VMware, AWS, and other providers. Then, industry-standard provisioning tools such as shell scripts, Chef, or Puppet, can automatically install and configure software on the virtual machine.

Download from https://www.vagrantup.com/downloads.html

Quick start for Windows 10

  • Enable Hyper-V
  • Download and run the Vagrant installer
  • Launch Powershell (as Administrator) and navigate to a folder of your choice
  • Initialise an Ubuntu environment using Hyper-V
    • vagrant init hashicorp/bionic64
  • Launch the box
    • vagrant up
  • SSH to the box
    • vagrant ssh

Recommended VS Code Extensions

  • Vagrantfile Support (Marco Stazi)

Things to do

Version control your environment

  • Commit the Vagrantfile to a repo

Optimise performance

  • Use vendor extentions?
  • More memory?
  • Copy or cloned disks?

Provision the environment

  • Update the operating system
  • Install software - eg nginx for a webserver
  • Forward network ports - eg access the webserver on port 8080

Vagrantfile examples

Minimal Vagrantfile

Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
    config.vm.box = "hashicorp/bionic64"
end

Using a provisioner

Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
    config.vm.box = "hashicorp/bionic64"    # Define the box
  
    config.vm.box_check_update = false      # Don't check for updates to the box
  
    config.vm.provider "hyperv" do |h|
        h.enable_virtualization_extensions = true       # Use Hyper-V extensions
        h.linked_clone = true                           # Use cloned disks
        h.memory = "1024"                               # Use 1G RAM
    end
  
    config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/vagrant", disabled: true   # Don't mount a sync folder
  
    config.ssh.insert_key = false     # Don't insert new SSH key, keep the INSECURE default key
  
    config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL       # Update the box
      apt-get update
      apt-get upgrade -y
    SHELL
  
end
